channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: No keynotes, no BS — why this year’s best tech talks happened over cocktails at StrictlyVC
item.description: Impactful talks and connections happen at StrictlyVC. Read the full 2025 recap and join the 2026 waitlist to get access to the lowest ticket prices.

item.title: The Best Linen Sheets for Cool and Comfy Sleeping (2025)
item.description: Linen might not be your first choice for bedsheets, but it’s got enough benefits that it's worth a try. Here’s the linen we love sleeping on.

item.title: Peripheral Labs taps into self-driving car sensors to bring sports fans right into the game
item.description: The startup has raised a $3.6 million seed round led by Khosla Ventures.

item.title: ChatGPT launches an app store, lets developers know it’s open for business
item.description: OpenAI is looking to populate its flagship chatbot with a host of new user experiences.

item.title: ChatGPT’s mobile app hits new milestone of $3B in consumer spending
item.description: ChatGPT has reached $3B in lifetime mobile consumer spending in just 31 months, faster than TikTok and major streaming apps.

item.title: Why British politicians are flocking to American tech giants
item.description: Former British Chancellor of the Exchequer George Osborne has joined OpenAI as managing director and head of OpenAI for Countries. He also will run Co...

item.title: Pickle Robot adds Tesla veteran as first CFO
item.description: Jeff Evanson recently joined Pickle Robot as the company's first CFO as the startup has allegedly expanded its partnership with UPS.

item.title: Instacart to pay $60M to settle FTC claims it deceived consumers
item.description: The federal agency alleged Instacart misled consumers with unlawful tactics, causing them to pay higher fees while also denying refunds.

item.title: Rivian rolls out new ‘Universal Hands-Free’ driving feature
item.description: The driver assistance software is available on Rivian's for Gen 2 R1 cars and works on 3.5 million miles of North American roads. But it doesn't slow ...

item.title: Apple opens up its App Store to competition in Japan
item.description: Epic Games CEO says Fortnite won't return to Japan, though, because the new rules still require high fees.
